summary: Emerging technologies and other economic forces have changed how U.S. workers work and the skills they need for the job market. This report describes a range of options, identified by experts in a GAO-sponsored virtual roundtable, to reform the current policies and programs for helping workers weather economic disruption. Potential reforms include: Establishing lifelong learning accounts for workers to fund continuous education and training opportunities...
title: Economic Adjustment Assistance: Experts' Proposed Reform Options to Better Serve Workers Experiencing Economic Disruption
